jade.core
Class Actor

java.lang.Object
  jade.core.Messenger
      jade.core.Actor

public abstract class Actor
extends Messenger

Represents anything that performs any action in a Jade World.

Constructor Summary

          Constructs a new, unbound Actor with the given face.

Constructor Detail

Actor

public Actor(ColoredChar face)
Constructs a new, unbound Actor with the given face.

Parameters:
face - the face of the new Actor
Method Detail

act

public abstract void act()
Carries out the action of the Actor. Often is usually called by the World in its tick method.

attach

public void attach(Actor actor)
Attaches this Actor to the given Actor. The position of this Actor then becomes that of the new holder. This Actor is removed from its current World and bount to the World of the new holder, although it will not be found on the grid of the World. Any Actor held by this Actor will also be moved with the new holder. An error is raised if the Actor is already held.

Parameters:
actor - the new holder

bound

public boolean bound()
Returns true if the Actor is bound to a World.

Returns:
true if the Actor is bound to a World

bound

public boolean bound(World world)
Returns true if the Actor is bound to the given World.

Parameters:
world - the world being tested
Returns:
true if the Actor is bound to the given World

changeFace

public void changeFace(ColoredChar face)
Changes the face of this Actor to a new one. Note that a null face is allowed, and implies that the Actor should never be drawn on screen, or have its face returned in World look methods.

Parameters:
face - the new face of the Actor

detach

public void detach()
Releases this Actor from its holder. The position of this Actor becomes independent of its former holder. It is also recorded as occupying the World grid. An error is raised by this method if the Actor was not held.

expire

public void expire()
Expires this Actor and every Actor held by this one, marking them for removal from its World.

expired

public boolean expired()
Returns true if the Actor is expired, which means it is marked for removal from its World.

Returns:
true if the Actor is expired

face

public ColoredChar face()
Returns the face of the Actor

Returns:
the face of the Actor

held

public boolean held()
Returns true if the Actor is currently held by another.

Returns:
true if the Actor is currently held by another

held

public boolean held(Actor actor)
Returns true if the given Actor is the holder of this Actor

Parameters:
actor - the Actor which is being queried as the holder
Returns:
true if the given Actor is the holder of this Actor

holder

public Actor holder()
Returns the current holder of this Actor, or null if there is none

Returns:
the current holder of this Actor

holds

public java.lang.Iterable<Actor> holds()
Returns all Actors currently held by this one

Returns:
all Actors currently held by this one

move

public final void move(Coord delta)
Sets the position of the Actor on the World to (x + dx, y + dy) where delta defines (dx, dy). An error is raised if the Actor is not bound to a World or if it is held by another Actor.

Parameters:
delta - the change in position

move

public final void move(Direction dir)
Sets the position of the Actor to be one step in the given direction. An error is raised if the Actor is not bound to a World or if it is held by another Actor.

Parameters:
dir - the direction of change

move

public final void move(int dx,
                       int dy)
Sets the position of the Actor on the World to (x + dx, y + dy). An error is raised if the Actor is not bound to a World or if it is held by another Actor.

Parameters:
dx - the change x
dy - the change y

pos

public Coord pos()
Returns a copy of the location of the Actor on the World. An error is raised if the Actor is not bound to a World. Note that the result is a copy, and changes to this Coord will not be reflected in the state of the Actor.

Returns:
the location of the Actor on the World

setPos

public final void setPos(Coord coord)
Sets the position of the Actor on the World to the value of the given Coord. An error is raised if the Actor is not bound to a World or if it is held by another Actor.

Parameters:
coord - the new position of the Actor on the World

setPos

public void setPos(int x,
                   int y)
Sets the position of the Actor on the World to (x, y). An error is raised if the Actor is not bound to a World or if it is held by another Actor.

Parameters:
x - the x value of the new location of the Actor on the World
y - the y value of the new location of the Actor on the World

world

public World world()
Returns the world on which the Actor resides, or null if the actor is not bound to a World.

Returns:
the world on which the Actor currently resides

x

public int x()
Returns the x value of the location of the Actor on the World. An error is raised if the Actor is not bound to a World.

Returns:
the x value of the location of the Actor on the World

y

public int y()
Returns the y value of the location of the Actor on the World. An error is raised if the Actor is not bound to a World.

Returns:
the y value of the location of the Actor on the World
